introduction.p:
Here are the definitions of even and odd.
An integer n \in \mathbb{Z} is even when there exists k \in \mathbb{Z} such that n = 2k.
An integer n \in \mathbb{Z} is odd when there exists k \in \mathbb{Z} such that n = 2k+1.
Use these definitions to prove the following statements.

statement.p: Prove that for all integers n \in \mathbb{Z}, if n is odd, then 5n + 3 is even.
Prove that if n \in \mathbb{Z}, then 5n^2+3n+7 is odd.
Prove that if a is any odd integer and b is any even integer, then 2a+3b is an even integer.
Prove that if a is any odd integer and b is any even integer, then a^2+b^2 is an odd integer.
Use a proof by contrapositive to show that for all integers m,n \in \mathbb{Z}, if mn is even then m is even or n is even.
Use a proof by contradiction to show that for any integer n \in \mathbb{Z}, we have 4 \nmid n^2-2.
Prove the following statement using either proof by contrapositive, or proof by contradiction.
For integers a,b,n \in \mathbb{Z}, if ab = n, then either a \geq \sqrt{n} or b \geq \sqrt{n}.
